snippet: Scientists say US 708— thought to be the fastest unbound star in the galaxy — was set in motion not by the black hole at the center of our galaxy, but by a former companion.
abstract: Dr Stephan Geier study in journal Science concludes that compact helium star known as US 708, fastest star in galaxy, was propelled to its speed of 1,200 kilometers a second by explosion of onetime companion star.
lead_paragraph: Scientists say US 708— thought to be the fastest unbound star in the galaxy — was set in motion not by the black hole at the center of our galaxy, but by a former companion.

headline.main: Fastest Star in the Galaxy Got an Unusual Start
headline.print_headline: Astronomy: Fastest Star in the Galaxy Had an Explosive Start
